label: [Swagger] An API for Scroll pHAT
info: ::: aim Defining a [Swagger]() OpenAPI for the I2C-based [Scroll pHAT](https://github.com/pimoroni/scroll-phat) LED board. ::: ::: warning This flow contains Http-In endpoinst definitions that could interrupt existing endpoints and services or open your Node-RED installation to malicious attacks. ::: ::: palette - [node-red-node-swagger](https://flows.nodered.org/node/node-red-node-swagger) - [github](node-red-node-swagger) ::: ::: requirements Installation of the flow for interfacing with the Scroll pHAT. This is assumed to be installed. ::: ### Flow Explanation ..TODO.. If all goes well, the Swagger definition for this flow will be accessible at [http://localhost:1880/http-api/swagger.json](http://localhost:1880/http-api/swagger.json) - if running Node-RED on localhost and port 1880. If you don't have a Scroll pHAT board, then go to the dashboard - there will be a 5 x 11 array of switches displayed that will be toggled accordingly. This virtual display is defined by the Scroll pHAT flow. ### Related flows - Flow for interfacing with the Scroll pHAT. - Flow for doing a ticker with the Scroll pHAT.

summary: Toggle on a pixel a specific column and row
description: Endpoint can used to either turn on or turn off a single pixel, a row of pixels or a column. A call with col = 0 and row = 0 will affect the entire display, either all on or all off.

parameters.name: col
parameters.description: Specify the column. A value between 0 and 11 (incl.). Zero means the entire column.

parameters.name: row
parameters.description: Specify the row. A value between 0 and 5 (incl.). Zero means the entire row.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: The action to be performed, must either be 'on' or 'off'.

200.description: All went well and the pixel is now on. Status value will be 'ok'

404.description: Pixel not found, out of bounds.

summary: Toggle on a pixel a specific column and row
description: This is the equivalent of the row value being zero, that is an entire column is affected by the action.

parameters.name: col
parameters.description: A value between 0 and 11 giving the column index.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Either 'on' of 'off' meaning toggle the pixel on or off.

200.description: All went well and the pixel is now on or off. Status value will always be 'ok'

404.description: Pixel not found, out of bounds

description: Set the brightness of the entire display. Zero is off and 127 is the brightest.

parameters.name: val
parameters.description: The brightness value from 0 (off) to 127 (brightest) - range is inclusive.

200.description: All went well and the pixel is now on or off. Status value will always be 'ok'

404.description: Pixel not found, out of bounds
